objects.name: Analytic 1449
objects.description: Closed-port knock sequence from a remote IP followed by on-host firewall change (iptables/nftables) or daemon starts listening (socket open) and a successful TCP/UDP connect. Optional detection of libpcap/raw-socket sniffers spawning to watch for secret values.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: Commands altering firewall or enabling listeners (iptables, nft, ufw, firewall-cmd, systemctl start *ssh*/*telnet*, ip route add, tcpdump, tshark)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: socket/bind: Process binds to a new local port shortly after knock

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Knock pattern: multiple REJ/S0 to distinct closed ports then successful connection to service_port

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Packets with unusual flags or payloads outside established flows (e.g., WoL magic FF×6 + 16×MAC)

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Percentage of failed attempts with RST/ICMP vs SYN/SYN-ACK to qualify as closed-port probing.
Automation expected to touch firewall/daemon configs (config-mgmt agents).
